entry.title: The South Shore Symphony with: Guest Conductor Marc Kissoczy & Violinist Ming-Feng Hsin
entry.summary: Tickets: $20 for Adults, $15 Seniors & Guild Members Program: Sibelius -- Karelia Overture Tchaikovsky - Violin Concerto          Ming-Feng Hsin, Violin Sibelius - Symphony No. 2 The South Shore Symphony is celebrating its 30th season as one of Long Island’s Top Orchestras. Under the direction of Scott Jackson Wiley, it performs a wide variety of classical and popular music in the Rockville Centre Area. What makes it unique is that it has some of the best professional and amateur musicians who volunteer their time and skills to perform for you. With moderate ticket prices, exciting musical selections and top level guest performers, The South Shore Symphony concerts are a great way to enjoy live music.
entry.content: Tickets: $20 for Adults, $15 Seniors & Guild Members Program: Sibelius -- Karelia Overture Tchaikovsky - Violin Concerto          Ming-Feng Hsin, Violin Sibelius - Symphony No. 2 The South Shore Symphony is celebrating its 30th season as one of Long Island’s Top Orchestras. entry.title: The South Shore Symphony: Mostly Mozart with Clarinet Soloist Stanley Drucker
entry.summary: Tickets: $20 for Adults and $15 Seniors & Guild Members Program: Guest Conductor: David Bernard Brahms - Symphony No. 2 Nielsen - Helios Overture Mozart - Clarinet Concerto in A (featuring Stanley Drucker, Clarinet Soloist) Stanley Drucker was the Principal Clarinetist of the New York Philharmonic for 49 years and continues to astonish audiences - A Long Island legend comes to the Madison Theatre. The South Shore Symphony is celebrating its 30th season as one of Long Island’s Top orchestras. Under the direction of Scott Jackson Wiley, it performs a wide variety of classical and popular music in the Rockville Centre Area. What makes it unique is that it has some of the best professional and amateur musicians who volunteer their time and skills to perform for you. With moderate ticket prices, exciting musical selections and top level guest performers, The South Shore Symphony concerts are a great way to enjoy live music.

entry.title: The South Shore Symphony: The Music of Ravel Pictures at an Exhibition
entry.summary: Tickets: $20 for Adults, $15 for Seniors & Guild Members Program: Scott Jackson Wiley: Conductor and Music Director Ravel -- Pavane for a Dead Princess Ravel -- Piano Concerto in G Guest soloist: Dmitry Glivinskiy, Piano Ravel -- Daphnis and Chloé The South Shore Symphony is celebrating its 30th season as one of Long Island’s Top Orchestras. entry.title: Sal Viviano in Perfectly Frank; Celebrating a Century of Sinatra Fundraiser for Vocal Scholarships
entry.summary: This extraordinary afternoon of music starring Sal Viviano will pay tribute to the incredible legacy of Frank Sinatra. Including hits such as “Come Fly with Me”, “The Way You Look Tonight”, “My Way”, “Fly Me to the Moon”, and “New York, New York”, this will be a celebration of the irrefutable talent of Sinatra, 100 years in the making. Don’t miss this opportunity to pay homage to one of the world’s greatest musicians - come experience the legend of Sinatra for yourself!
entry.content: This extraordinary afternoon of music starring Sal Viviano will pay tribute to the incredible legacy of Frank Sinatra. Including hits such as “Come Fly with Me”, “The Way You Look Tonight”, “My Way”, “Fly Me to the Moon”, and “New York, New York”, this will be a celebration of the irrefutable talent of Sinatra, 100 years in the making. Don’t miss this opportunity to pay homage to one of the world’s greatest musicians - come experience the legend of Sinatra for yourself!

entry.title: Making Books Sing presents: “The Beautiful Game”
entry.summary: Making Books Sing’s mission is to encourage children’s mastery of literature through professional theatre productions. Their productions bring to life socially relevant matters that will inspire and enrich your children’s lives. This will be a family outing like no other!
entry.content: Making Books Sing’s mission is to encourage children’s mastery of literature through professional theatre productions. Their productions bring to life socially relevant matters that will inspire and enrich your children’s lives. This will be a family outing like no other!

entry.title: Peter White Concert
entry.summary: In association with Alan Stein Peter White has maintained a reputation as one of the most versatile and prolific acoustic guitarists on the contemporary jazz landscape. Armed with an unparalleled combination of lyricism and energy, he combines elements of jazz, pop and classical guitar to create a sound that is singular and at the same time accessible to a broad audience.
entry.content: In association with Alan Stein Peter White has maintained a reputation as one of the most versatile and prolific acoustic guitarists on the contemporary jazz landscape. Armed with an unparalleled combination of lyricism and energy, he combines elements of jazz, pop and classical guitar to create a sound that is singular and at the same time accessible to a broad audience.

entry.title: William Shakespeare’s A Midsummer Night’s Dream
entry.summary: The course of true love never does run smooth. This fast paced mad-capped comedy brings magic and frivolity in the ethereal world Shakespeare created in A Midsummer Night’s Dream. As the enchanted lovers become a circle of frustration - Lysander is made to love Helena, who still loves Demetrius, who still loves Hermia, who still loves Lysander - saucy exchanges alternate with good old-fashioned female wrestling. It’s fun for the whole family!
entry.content: The course of true love never does run smooth. This fast paced mad-capped comedy brings magic and frivolity in the ethereal world Shakespeare created in A Midsummer Night’s Dream. As the enchanted lovers become a circle of frustration - Lysander is made to love Helena, who still loves Demetrius, who still loves Hermia, who still loves Lysander - saucy exchanges alternate with good old-fashioned female wrestling. It’s fun for the whole family!

entry.title: The Gershwin Project Featuring Peter Nero
entry.summary: Critically acclaimed jazz pianist Peter Nero leads his unparalleled Pops orchestra infused with music from all genres including: classical, swing, Broadway, blues, and jazz. Hailed by The Washington Post as “the epitome of the Pops Conductor/Performer,” Peter Nero blends his eclectic passion for music with his love for his audience.
entry.content: Critically acclaimed jazz pianist Peter Nero leads his unparalleled Pops orchestra infused with music from all genres including: classical, swing, Broadway, blues, and jazz. Hailed by The Washington Post as “the epitome of the Pops Conductor/Performer,” Peter Nero blends his eclectic passion for music with his love for his audience.

entry.title: The Nutcracker Ballet
entry.summary: We ring in the holiday season with Tchaikovsky’s classic ballet, The Nutcracker with the Leggz Ltd. Ballet Company, under the Artistic Direction of Joan Hope MacNaughton. Our full-length production with live orchestra has no equal anywhere on Long Island! The South Shore Symphony summons all its forces to accompany a 90 member corps de ballet. In addition to the composer’s full score, this magical extravaganza features talented and gifted young dancers from all over the greater metropolitan area and guest ballet stars from major renowned ballet companies. A must-see Holiday Tradition!
entry.content: We ring in the holiday season with Tchaikovsky’s classic ballet, The Nutcracker with the Leggz Ltd. Ballet Company, under the Artistic Direction of Joan Hope MacNaughton. Our full-length production with live orchestra has no equal anywhere on Long Island! The South Shore Symphony summons all its forces to accompany a 90 member corps de ballet. In addition to the composer’s full score, this magical extravaganza features talented and gifted young dancers from all over the greater metropolitan area and guest ballet stars from major renowned ballet companies. A must-see Holiday Tradition!

entry.title: The South Shore Symphony: The Classical Legacy of a Rock Star Featuring: Keith Emerson
entry.summary: Program: Scott Jackson Wiley: Conductor and Music Director Keith Emerson: Glorietta’s Pass (conducted by Keith Emerson) Keith Emerson: Piano Concerto No. 1 (1977) Jeffrey Biegel: Piano Soloist Mussorgsky/Ravel: Pictures at an Exhibition Keith Emerson: Solo version of Tarkus Keith Emerson: Pianist Keith Emerson: Honky Tonk Train Blues Keith Emerson with members of the orchestra The South Shore Symphony is celebrating its 30th season as one of Long Island’s Top Orchestras. Under the direction of Scott Jackson Wiley, it performs a wide variety of classical and popular music in the Rockville Centre Area. What makes it unique is that it has some of the best professional and amateur musicians who volunteer their time and skills to perform for you. With moderate ticket prices, exciting musical selections and top level guest performers, The South Shore Symphony concerts are a great way to enjoy live music.
